name: Go Walk "East Of Eden" Online Quiz | Steinbeck, John | 20 Questions

questions.text: Where does this story take place?
questions.explanation:
Northern California.

	Excerpt from the book: "The Salinas Valley is in Northern California. It is a long narrow swale between two ranges of mountains and the Salinas Valley winds and twists up the center until it falls at last into the Monterey Bay."

questions.text: What are the names of the Trask brothers?
questions.explanation:
Adam and Charles.

	Adam is from Cyrus Trask's first marriage to a woman only known as Mrs. Trask. Charles was born nine months after Cyrus and his second wife, Alice, married.

questions.text: Charles was Cyrus' favorite son?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Adam was Cyrus' favorite son and Charles constantly beat Adam because of that fact.

questions.text: What branch of the service did Adam join?
questions.explanation:
Army.

	Adam becaue a private in the Calvary.

questions.text: Who killed Cathy Ames' parents?
questions.explanation:
Cathy.

	After Cathy killed her parents, she worked in a whorehouse where she was almost beaten to death in a jealous rage. Badly beaten, Cathy found her way to the farm house of Adam and Charles Trask.

questions.text: How many children did Samuel and Liza Hamilton have?
questions.explanation:
nine & 9.

	Excerpt from the book: "Over the years, nine children were born, four boys and five girls. With each birth another quarter section was added to the ranch and that makes eleven quarter sections or seventeen hundred sixty acres."

questions.text: Did Charles married Cathy?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Adam married Cathy after she healed from the beating. On their wedding night, Cathy slept with Charles while Adam slept.

questions.text: Which Hamilton sister was John Steinbeck's mother?
questions.explanation:
Olive.

	Olive became a teacher before marrying and had three daughters and a son.

questions.text: Cathy gave birth to twins.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Two weeks after her two sons were born, Cathy shot Adam and abandoned the twins. She went to work as a prostitute at a house owned by a woman named Faye.

questions.text: A year later, what did Adam and Samuel Hamilton name the twin boys?
questions.explanation:
Caleb and Aron.

	Excerpt from book: "Cal is sharp and dark and watchful and his brother---well he's a boy you like before he speaks and like more afterward."

questions.text: Did Adam go Samuel's funeral?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Samuel died on March fifteenth.

questions.text: Who did Adam go to see in Salinas?
questions.explanation:
Cathy.

	By now, Cathy had taken on the alias of Kate. Adam talked to her for a while and then left feeling better than he had since she shot him and left.

questions.text: At the post office, Adam got a letter stating that which member of his family had passed away?
questions.explanation:
Charles.

	When Adam took the boys to the post office, he got the letter from a lawyer saying that his brother Charles had died and left money to both him and Cathy.

questions.text: What was Caleb arrested for?
questions.explanation:
Gambling.

	Caleb was arrested for gambling, but it was proven that he was just there and not doing any gambling. Adam came to get him from jail and take him home.

questions.text: Did Caleb ever meet his mom?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	He went to see her after hearing that she was a prostitute in King City. He ran out after Cathy told him that he was the most like her.

questions.text: What war was Aron killed in?
questions.explanation:
World War I.

	To get away from his family and his recently discovered mother, Aron lied about his age and joined the Army. He died in the war.

questions.text: How did Cathy die?
questions.explanation:
She took pills.

	Excerpt from the book: "And her heart beat solemnly and her breathing slowed as she grew smaller and smaller and then disappeared--and she had never been."

questions.text: Adam had a stroke.
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	After hearing of Aron's death, Adam had a stroke that paralyzed his left side and left partial paralysis on his right side.

questions.text: What word did Adam mutter that told Caleb he wasn't to blame for Aron's death?
questions.explanation:
Timshel.

	Timshel is the belief that every person has the right to choose his own path.

questions.text: What was the name of the girl that Aron and Caleb both fell for?
questions.explanation:
Abra.

	Abra and Caleb end up together.
